input.description:
adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter to use to handle the request.
Default value: VMwareInfrastructure

items The items XML used to perform "Clone VM with Custom Settings" operation.
Value takes the form:
<items> <item> <parameters> <virtual-machine></virtual-machine> <folder></folder> <datacenter></datacenter> <name></name> <spec> <power-on></power-on> <template></template> <location> <resource-pool></resource-pool> <cluster-compute-resource></cluster-compute-resource> <host-system></host-system> <datastore></datastore> <transform></transform> <disk-list> <disk> <disk-id></disk-id> <datastore></datastore> </disk> .......... </disk-list> </location> <config> <version></version> <guest-id></guest-id> <annotation></annotation> <tools> <tools-version></tools-version> <after-power-on></after-power-on> <after-resume></after-resume> <before-guest-standby></before-guest-standby> <before-guest-shutdown></before-guest-shutdown> <before-guest-reboot></before-guest-reboot> </tools> <flags> <disable-acceleration></disable-acceleration> <enable-logging></enable-logging> <use-toe></use-toe> <run-with-debug-info></run-with-debug-info> <ht-sharing></ht-sharing> </flags> <console-preferences> <power-on-when-opened></power-on-when-opened> <enter-full-screen-on-power-on></enter-full-screen-on-power-on> <close-on-power-off-or-suspend></close-on-power-off-or-suspend> </console-preferences> <power-op-info> <power-off-type></power-off-type> <suspend-type></suspend-type> <reset-type></reset-type> <default-power-off-type></default-power-off-type> <default-suspend-type></default-suspend-type> <default-reset-type></default-reset-type> </power-op-info> <num-cpus></num-cpus> <memory-mb></memory-mb> <device-change-list> <!--Zero or more repetitions:--> <device-change> <operation>?</operation> <file-operation>?</file-operation> <device xsi:type=""> <key>0</key> <device-info> <label>?</label> <summary>?</summary> </device-info> <backing type=""> <file-name>?</file-name> <disk-mode>?</disk-mode> <split>?</split> <write-through>?</write-through> <thin-provisioned>?</thin-provisioned> <device-name>?</device-name> <exclusive>?</exclusive> </backing> <connectable> <start-connected>?</start-connected> <allow-guest-control>?</allow-guest-control> <connected>?</connected> </connectable> <controller-key>?</controller-key> <unit-number>?</unit-number> <bus-number>?</bus-number> <device>?</device> <shared-bus>?</shared-bus> <capacityInKB>?</capacityInKB> <address-type>?</address-type> <mac-address>?</mac-address> <wake-on-lan-enabled>?</wake-on-lan-enabled> <shares> <shares>?</shares> <level>?</level> </shares> </device> </device-change> <device-change> ....... </device-change> </device-change-list> <cpu-allocation> <reservation></reservation> <limit></limit> <shares> <shares></shares> <level></level> </shares> </cpu-allocation> <memory-allocation> <reservation></reservation> <limit></limit> <shares> <shares></shares> <level></level> </shares> </memory-allocation> <cpu-affinity> <affinity-set-list> <affinity-set></affinity-set> ............ </affinity-set-list> </cpu-affinity> <memory-affinity> <affinity-set-list> <affinity-set></affinity-set> ......... </affinity-set-list> </memory-affinity> <network-shaper> <enabled></enabled> <peak-bps></peak-bps> <average-bps></average-bps> <burst-size></burst-size> </network-shaper> <cpu-feature-mask-list> <cpu-feature-mask> <operation></operation> <info> <level></level> <vendor></vendor> <eax></eax> <ebx></ebx> <ecx></ecx> <edx></edx> </info> </cpu-feature-mask> .............. </cpu-feature-mask-list> </config> <customization> <identity type=""> <gui-unattended> <time-zone></time-zone> <auto-logon></auto-logon> <auto-logon-count></auto-logon-count> </gui-unattended> <user-data> <full-name></full-name> <org-name></org-name> <computer-name> <name></name> </computer-name> <product-id></product-id> </user-data> <gui-run-once> <command></command> <command></command> </gui-run-once> <identification> <join-workgroup></join-workgroup> </identification> <license-file-print-data> <auto-mode></auto-mode> <auto-users></auto-users> </license-file-print-data> <!--<host-name> <name></name> </host-name> <domain></domain> --></identity> <globalIPSettings> <dns-server-list> <dns-server-list></dns-server-list> <dns-server-list></dns-server-list> </dns-server-list> <dns-suffix-list> <dns-suffix-list></dns-suffix-list> <dns-suffix-list></dns-suffix-list> </dns-suffix-list> </globalIPSettings> <nic-setting-map> <adapter> <ip type=""> <ipAddress></ipAddress> </ip> <subnet-mask></subnet-mask> <gateway></gateway> <dns-domain></dns-domain> </adapter> </nic-setting-map> </customization> </spec> </parameters> </item> </items>
For description of each parameter tags, please refer Construct Item for Clone VM with Custom Settings process.

connection parameters [optional] The XML containing the metadata needed by the adapter to connect to the target.
Value takes the form:
<connection-parameters> <soap-url></soap-url> <transport></transport> <user-name></user-name> <password></password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

documentation.description: Clone VM with Custom Settings Creates a new VM with the custom configuration as a specified VM.
